content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Farhad Abbasi from Iran. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: Hello Mr. Abbasi, I'm glad you're interested in my apartment. The rental price is negotiable, so feel free to make an offer. Remember, we're only discussing the rental price here, not additional responsibilities, lease term conditions, or utility costs.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
What is the purpose of the "TERMINATE" keyword in the negotiation dialogue?

In the negotiation dialogue, the "TERMINATE" keyword is used to indicate that the negotiation has been successful and that the parties have reached an agreement on the rental price. When one party says "TERMINATE", it signals to the other party that the negotiation has come to an end and that the agreed-upon rental price is final.

However, if the negotiation does not result in an agreement, either party can say "TERMINATE" to indicate that the negotiation has failed and that they are not interested in continuing to negotiate. In this case, the negotiation will end without a successful agreement.

Therefore, the "TERMINATE" keyword serves as a way to formally end the negotiation dialogue and signal that a final agreement has been reached, or that the negotiation has failed and will not continue.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran
